intro: Corunastylis vernalis, commonly known as the spring starflower, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant features delicate, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Corunastylis vernalis thrives in moist, woodland habitats and is often found in shaded environments.
